content: Am I hallucinating or is docs#eq_zero_of_add_nonneg_left (and right) the wrong way 'round? Same type signature as the nonpos versions.

I don't think so... The signature of eq_zero_of_add_nonneg_left is eq_zero_of_add_nonneg_left.{u_1} {α : Type u_1} [inst✝ : AddZeroClass α] [inst✝¹ : PartialOrder α] [inst✝² : CovariantClass α α (fun x x_1 => x + x_1) fun x x_1 => x ≤ x_1] {a b : α} (ha : a ≤ 0) (hb : b ≤ 0) (hab : 0 ≤ a + b) : a = 0 where a ≤ 0 seems like an odd way to spell nonneg
cutting the faff, that's eq_zero_of_add_nonneg_left.{u_1} {α : Type u_1} {a b : α} (ha : a ≤ 0) (hb : b ≤ 0) (hab : 0 ≤ a + b) : a = 0

And oddly, eq_zero_of_add_nonpos_left {α : Type u_1} [AddZeroClass α] [PartialOrder α] [CovariantClass α α (fun (x x_1 : α) => x + x_1) fun (x x_1 : α) => x ≤ x_1] {a : α} {b : α} (ha : 0 ≤ a) (hb : 0 ≤ b) (hab : a + b ≤ 0) : a = 0

The "nonneg" hypothesis in eq_zero_of_add_nonneg_left is the (hab : 0 ≤ a + b). The other two hypotheses (that a and b are nonpositive`) aren't mentioned in the theorem's name, but are needed in order for the theorem to hold.

Thanks -- yes, I realized this after I tried to prove the two functions were equal, and saw that the difference was in the hab -- as usual, Kevin was right; the conceptual error was parsing nonneg_left rather than add_nonneg
